editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).

Full documentation of the original data capture process is available from the Text Creation Partnership web site. All versions of the texts are now archived and freely available for download. See the TCP Download FAQ for detailed information. The TEI P5 versions are also freely available from the TCP Github repository.

div.head: At the Heart and Star, over against the Black-Bull, in the Great Old-Baily, lives a PHYSICIAN.
div.p: WHO by the Blessing of God on his great Study, Pains, Travels, and daily Experience, hath ever had wonderful Success in Curing the following Diseases, viz. Cancers, Ulcers, and Cankers of all kinds; Consumptions, and Coughs, the King's-Evil, Joynt Evil, and all scrophulous Humours: The Stone, or Gravel in the Reins or Bladder, he perfectly dissolves, and brings away with ease; the which is not known to be perform'd by any Person but himself: And gives great Ease in the violent Pains of the Gout, perfecting the Cure, if Curable.

He Cures all Pains in the Limbs, Cramps, Pleuresies, Rheumatisms, or Wind-Gout; the Dropsie, Itch, Scurvey, Lousie-Evil, Falling-sickness, Fits, Faintings, Vapours, and Jaundice of all sorts: All the different kinds of Fevers and Agues, Imposthumes; and all unnatural Swellings; Worms, Cholick, Head-ach, Madness, Forgetfullness; Deafness; and all Infirmities of the Eyes; Stinking-breath, Ptysick, or shortness of Breath, Green-sickness, Barrenness, and prevents Miscarriages; with many secret Infirmities, relating to the Female-Sex: Also the Rickets in Children he Cures in three Weeks, or a Months time at farthest: Crookedness in Children, from two to sixteen Years of Age: Ruptures, or broken Bellies, and such as cannot hold their Water; Leprosies, or scald Heads.

He Cureth the Venereal Disease, with all its Symptoms, after a new, pleasant, speedy, and safe Method, without Fluxing, Confinement, loss of Business, or Dangerous and Poysonous Merourial Preparations: And has also an incomparable Anti-venereal Pill, that Cures the running of the Reins, Heat of Urine, and all other Symptoms of the Venereal Disease in a short time, price from 2 s. 6 d. to 5 s. the Box.

He hath a most excellent Elixir Proprietatis, far exceeding all vulgar Preparations, price from 2 s. 6 d. to 5 s. the Bottle, with its extraordinary Vertues, and Directions how to use it. He also prepareth a most admirable Chymical Balsamic Spirit, which speedily Cureth all green Wounds, and old invetrate Ulcers to admiration, price from 2 s. 6 d. to 5 s. the Bottle.

He hath also a singular Cathartick Family-Pill, Strengthening and Restorative far beyond any yet known, and most admirable in the Relief of many of the above mentioned Distempers; they may be safely taken at all Times and Seasons, and keep good many Years, as well by Sea as Land, tho' carried into hot Countries: He hath sold great Quantities to the East-Indies, and to Jamaica, and Barbadoes, and to other Parts of the West-Indies; they most effectually Cure the Distempers of those Countries; and now for the Publick good, are sold for 2 s. 6 d. and 5 s. the Box.

He likewise hath the most excellent Anti-Febrifick, with which he hath Cured many Hundreds, when other Means have failed, and have
been thought past Cure by others: It never fails (if curable) to take off the height of the Fever in six Hours, reviving and chearing the Spirits to admiration. The like no other can produce.
Those that by way of prevention would secure themselves against the Distempers that usually afflict Mankind, may take 2 or 3 Doses of his Pills and Elixir, than which, nothing is better.
He gives Judgment on Urines, and all Distempers, and Candidly deals with the Patients in Resolving them, whether Cureable or not.
And for the satisfaction of those that think any Season of the Year improper to take Physick in; it may be adviseable to assure them, that when ever a Distemper seizes, it's then time to seek Relief.

It would be tedious to insert the many Cures he hath performed, and therefore shall trouble the Reader only with these few following, viz. The Wife of Mr. Parker, Ribbon-Weaver, in Nicholas-street in Shore-ditch, who was in a languishing Condition for 2 Years, with a continual Pain and Tumor in the Womb, and was persuaded for a long time that she was with Child; and given over by many Physicians, some affirming that she had a Devil in her; and by the Blessing of God, she was perfectly restored to Health by him in 3 Months. The Wife of Mr. John Seal, Weaver, in Cock-Alley, in the same Street, that had been tormented with an Ulcer in the Womb 12 Months, he cured in a little less than 2 Months. Also Mrs. Jones, near the Cock, in the same Street, had a Quartane Ague 9 Months, and finding no benefit by several Physicians, was cured by him in a Week. Mr. Roger Combs in Salisbury-Court, who was afflicted with the Dropsy, Yellow-jaundice, and Cholick, he cured in 6 Weeks. Mr. Green in Salisbury-Court, he cured of a Dropsy in 3 Weeks, being given over by others. He cured John Wooton of Puddle-Dock, Carman, of the Dropsy, in 3 Weeks. The Wife of Mr. Bradley Emmery-man in Salisbury-Court, he cured of a Fever, Vomiting, and the Obstruction of Urine, in 12 Days, after gi
•• n over by others. Mrs. Jones, at the Cloth-workers Arms in PlowStreet in White-Chappel, he cured of a virulent Flux, in a Month. Mr. Fausters Wife of Ratclif, against School-lane End, was cured of a Deafness by him in 3 Months. The Son of Mr. Hunt, a Tobacco-pipe Maker over against the Sugar-loaf in Salisbury-Court, had the Rickets and Consumption at 4 Years old, wherewith he became a Cripple, and was perfectly Cured by him in 2 Months.
He could name many Hundred more, (were it proper) that he hath Cured of all the Distempers that afflict Mankind.
He hath convenient Lodgings for any Patient that desires to be private.
And is to be spoken with from 8 in the Morning 'till 11, and from 2 'till 6 at Night
